messages.text: Hi — I am Allie. Ask me anything.

The official name of Peru is "República de Perú," which means "Republic of Peru." Its borders include Ecuador to the north, Brazil to the east, Bolivia to the south, and the Pacific Ocean to the west. According to DuckDuckGo, Christianity is the most commonly practiced religion in Peru, followed closely by Catholicism. Regarding the second part of your query about whether there is any irreligion in Peru, according to OpenLibrary, there has been a slight decline in religions other than Catholicism since the Spanish Conquest, with Protestant churches of various denominations having gained significant ground. which country in south america has the largest GDP

Bolivia is currently ranked as the world's seventh-largest economy by the World Bank. draft:
Brazil has the largest GDP in South America, with a nominal GDP of approximately $2.3 trillion as of October 2024. It also has the largest GDP by purchasing power parity (PPP) at over $4.9 trillion. Brazil's large economy is supported by its abundant natural resources, diversified industrial base, and strong agricultural sector. 
Nominal GDP: Brazil has the highest nominal GDP in South America.
Purchasing Power Parity (PPP): Brazil also leads the continent in GDP based on PPP. 
Economic Strengths: The country's economic power is a result of its natural resources, developed industrial sectors like petroleum processing and aerospace, and its position as a leading agricultural producer
